intro: Brassica oleracea proles capitata, commonly known as broccoli, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its compact, leafy head and green flower buds. It is a biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 40–90 cm, with thick, fleshy stems and large, serrated leaves. The edible part of the plant consists of the flower heads, which are formed by tightly clustered green florets. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Broccoli is rich in nutrients such as vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants, making it a valuable vegetable in both culinary and nutritional contexts.
